Participants.evidence: Three hundred fifty-one patients operated between 1993 and 2002 for rectal carcinoma, at or below the peritoneal reflection, were analyzed.

Intervention.evidence: Lateral lymph node dissection (LLND) was performed in suspected T3 or T4 disease, or when positive lymph nodes were seen; 73 patients received unilateral LLND and 133 patients received bilateral LLND.

Objective.evidence: The purpose was to study the risk factors for local relapse and the patterns of local recurrence.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Of the 351 patients 6.6% developed local recurrence after 5 years.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Three hundred fifty-one patients operated between 1993 and 2002 for rectal carcinoma, at or below the peritoneal reflection, were analyzed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: 33% of the unilateral LLND group had local relapse, significantly more ( p = 0.04) than in the bilateral LLND group with 14% local recurrence.
